item.title: Ben add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "The most important thing in life is to learn how to give out love, and to let it come in." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Ben add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Ben add a quote by Chris Rock
item.description: "You know the world is going crazy when the best rapper is a white guy, the best golfer is a black guy, the tallest guy in the NBA is Chinese, the Swiss hold the America's Cup, France is accusing the U.S. of arrogance, Germany doesn't want to go to war, and the three most powerful men in America are named "Bush", "Dick", and "Colin." Need I say more?" -- Chris Rock

item.title: Ben add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Ben add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Ben add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Ben add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "I ask people why they have deer heads on their walls. They always say because it's such a beautiful animal. There you go. I think my mother is attractive, but I have photographs of her." -- Ellen DeGeneres

item.title: Ben add a quote by J. K. Rowling
item.description: "The thing about growing up with Fred and George," said Ginny thoughtfully, "is that you sort of start thinking anything's possible if you've got enough nerve." -- J. K. Rowling

item.title: Ben add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Ben add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "To be is to do" -- Socrates

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "1492. As children we were taught to memorize this year with pride and joy as the year people began living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America. Actually, people had been living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America for hundreds of years before that. 1492 was simply the year sea pirates began to rob, cheat, and kill them." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ben add a quote by Emerson, Ralph Waldo
item.description: "I cannot remember the books I've read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me." -- Emerson, Ralph Waldo

item.title: Ben add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Ben add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Ben add a quote by Jerry Spinelli
item.description: "She was elusive. She was today. She was tomorrow. She was the faintest scent of a cactus flower, the flitting shadow of an elf owl. We did not know what to make of her. In our minds we tried to pin her to a cork board like a butterfly, but the pin merely went through and away she flew." -- Jerry Spinelli

item.title: Ben add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "A scrupulous writer, in every sentence that he writes, will ask himself at least four questions, thus: 1. What am I trying to say? 2. What words will express it? 3. What image or idiom will make it clearer? 4. Is this image fresh enough to have an effect?" -- George Orwell

item.title: Ben add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others." -- George Orwell

item.title: Ben add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength." -- George Orwell

item.title: Ben add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Ben add a quote by Confucious
item.description: "Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life." -- Confucious

item.title: Ben add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Ben add a quote by Bill Keane
item.description: "Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present." -- Bill Keane

item.title: Ben add a quote by Jean Jacques Rousseau
item.description: "People who know little are usually great talkers, while men who know much say little." -- Jean Jacques Rousseau

item.title: Ben add a quote by Greg Mortenson
item.description: "I've learned that terror doesn't happen because some group of people somewhere like Pakistan or Afghanistan simply decide to hate us. It happens because children aren't being offered a bright enough future that they have a reason to choose life over death." -- Greg Mortenson

item.title: Ben add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Ben add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "I have from an early age abjured the use of meat, and the time will come when men such as I will look upon the murder of animals as they now look upon the murder of men." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Ben add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Ben add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "We cannot change the cards we are dealt, just how we play the hand." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Ben add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White
